@@ -0,0 +1,96 @@
+package scala.meta.internal.metals
+
+import scala.meta.io.AbsolutePath
+import java.net.URI
+import scala.concurrent.Future
+import MetalsEnrichments._
+import java.nio.file.Files
+import scala.concurrent.ExecutionContext
+import scala.util.control.NonFatal
+
+class NewFilesProvider(
+    workspace: AbsolutePath,
+    packageProvider: PackageProvider
+) {
+
+  def createNewFile(directory: Option[URI], name: String, kind: String)(
+      implicit ec: ExecutionContext
+  ): Future[URI] = kind match {
+    case "class" | "object" | "trait" =>
+      createClass(directory, name, kind)
+    case "package-object" =>
+      createPackageObject(directory)
+    case "worksheet" =>
+      createWorksheet(directory, name)
+    case _ => Future.failed(new IllegalArgumentException)

comments.body:
I've made some kind of DSL here, to cover `Future[Option[_]]` handling (making this method more or readable). `Future` is for about remote requests, and `Option` reflect that the request can be cancelled (thus, nothing should be returned eventually).
Not sure, if it's good here.

comments.body:
Do we need to fully qualify `Range` here?

Maybe `path.toURI.toString` to be on the save side and you should be able to remove `: Object`

`Range` fixed.
Good catch with `toURI`, thanks!
`:Object` can not be ommitted, since it's Java List eventually, and it's not covariant. It's the same with already existing cases of calling `ClientCommands.GotoLocation`
I think you can add the execution context to the class constructor - it will be the same anyway
done

comments.body:
Looks good, this is almost a MonadTransformer haha.

Maybe `flatMapOption` and `mapOption` ? This will be a bit more natural.

And these methods might be actually useful to add to `MetalsEnrichments`, I remember situations when we were combining Futures and Options.
Yeah, I also thought about `OptionT` :D . Done
You can use `touch` from `XtensionAbsolutePathBuffers`
`touch` does not return the path, and although I already have the path, I like to reuse output of the function.
Can we change touch to return the path?

What happens if the name is `a/b/c/A` - I think we should create the directories there. Most likely `createFile` should also create directories? Package will then be added automatically which is neat.
it fails. Not really sure, it looks neat to ask for the name for the new class `foo/Bar` to create `class Bar`at `foo/Bar.scala`
Could we implement it here? I think we just need to do `getParent.mkdirs`

comments.body:
I've changed this to also accept a `name`, so that we can skip the name-picking dialog and just ask for a file kind.

This allows the code action to fully re-use the existing provider's flow, which I think is really nice
Let's also maybe ask if the name is empty? I think that breaks in the current behaviour.
what you mean? Empty string? I can add a test but can you explain why do you think it breaks the current functionality?
Anyway, I've added handling blank values

My editor is set to strip out whitespaces on save, so I've been struggling with this.

I think it's much clearer this way, anyway.
I agree this is clearer. I also have my editor remove trailing whitespace on save, intellij has this enabled by default, so we should not rely on it in our tests
I also like this as I get a warning in vim about trailing whitespaces all the time ha.
maybe `FileAlreadyExistsException`?
Good idea! Changed
Ah, good call adding this in üëç
